Randolph Elevator Out of Service
The Randolph Station elevator is temporarily out of service. Recommended alternative accessible locations are South Water and Van Buren.

Metra Electric Platform Changes
Metra Electric- Inbound and outbound trains will board from the north end of the platform at 47th St., 27th St., McCormick Place, and 18th St.

UPNW 644 Delayed
UPNW Inbound train 644 is delayed 15 to 30 minutes due to track construction.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
ME 216 On the Move
Metra Electric- Train #216 scheduled to arrive Chicago at 11:20 AM is on the move and may be operating 18 to 22 minutes behind schedule due to police activity.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Homewood East Side Construction Will Begin March 13

Beginning Monday, March 13, access to the Homewood Station from the east will be closed for station construction until Summer 2024.  Access to the boarding platform will be through the Park Avenue entrance ONLY (west side of tracks).

 

Beginning, Monday, March 6, the Pace bus stop will relocate from Harwood Avenue to Park Avenue.  Please allow additional time and use caution near the work zone.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert UP-NW - Clybourn Station Platform Rehabilitation

The north half of platform #2 at the Clybourn station is closed for rehabilitation. Once completed, the work will begin on the south half of platform #2 and into platform #1. The project is scheduled to be completed by the end of July.

Please allow addtional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Attention Metra Electric Line Riders

Due to the NASCAR events being held in Grant Park July 1-2, two access points to Van Buren St. Station will be temporarily closed starting June 17 until after the event: the path between Jackson St. and the platforms and the path through the “Paris Metro” entrance at Van Buren on the east side of Michigan Ave. The access points at Van Buren on the west side of Michigan Ave. will remain open and Metra Electric service will not be impacted.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-W -  Attention Schaumburg Riders.

Starting Wednesday, June 21 at 7:00 a.m., Metra will close Rodenburg Road to replace the railroad crossing.  Local traffic will be unable to cross the tracks.  Detour signs will be posted.  Those wishing to park in the south lot (Roselle side) should do so via Travis Parkkway and Gary Ave.  Crews will be working through the weekend and expect the Rodenburg Road railroad crossing to reopen on Thursday, June 29 at 7:00 a.m.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI - Midlothian Pedestrian Bridge Repairs - Thursday 6/22 through Monday 6/26

The Midlothian pedestrian bridge that leads to the Midliothian station south parking lot will be closed for repairs beginning Thursday, June 22 through Monday, June 26. During this time, commuters should allow themselves extra time when heading to the station.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert BNSF - Service added to four lines for Pride Parade.

Metra will add trains to its BNSF, Union Pacific North, Union Pacific Northwest and Union Pacific West lines on Sunday, June 25, to accommodate those planning to attend Chicago’s 52nd Annual Pride Parade, click here

Metra Alert UP-N - Peterson Ave will be closed overnight June 24 due to bridge work

Commuters are advised to avoid Peterson Avenue near Ridge and Ravenswood avenues Saturday night, June 24. Lanes will be reduced on Peterson at the bridge beginning at 5 p.m. Saturday, June 24 through 8 a.m. Sunday, June 25, while contractors oversee scheduled bridge work.  For more information click here.
